content: [Applause] come on this is ridiculous and I gotta
fix it
hey guys welcome back to black magic craft building things is really fun
building cool things on this channel is really fun and really entertaining but
sometimes you got to do a bit of housekeeping I'm sure many of you can
relate to this organizing crafting materials tools supplies it can be a
challenge and I have a whole room dedicated to my hobby and it's still a
challenge one of the most frustrating things in my setup is this my drawer of
random small tools and stuff that I use most frequently this is my go-to drawer
when I did my Q&A video people ask me about organization and advice and my
main advice was first order retrieve ability have a place for everything and
have that place be somewhere that you can grab the thing you need instantly
without having to move other stuff out of the way because it gets lost and
forgotten about and this drawer well goes against all of my advice it is an
absolute mess so today I'm gonna build an organizer for this craft drawer not
the most exciting project but an important one nonetheless and taking
this time to complete something like this is going to make me more efficient
long-term more creative and just overall be able to do what I do better and
faster and that's one of the crucial things about this hobby is finding ways
to do things efficiently so that you actually do them anything
spend your time looking for your dang knife in a drawer of junk I have all
these bones minis like over 200 minis have painted three of them I need to
move some of these over onto the shelves clear up some space and then I'm going
to empty this drawer out I'm gonna separate it get rid of the stuff I don't
need on hand all the time figure out what is the most important and then I
bought some of this nice black foam core from Dollar Rama this foam core is not
the easy peel stuff from Dollar Tree this is Studio brand from Dollarama and
I like it because one the paper is really bonded
meaning it's strong for making something like this and the foam core itself is
actually black so it will look a lot better in the drawer so let's start
organizing and let's build
all right so I got the drawer cleaned out separated all the junk that I don't
need right beside me at all times and all the stuff I want to keep in here so
the first part of this is gonna be building a basic box tray thing that
fits right inside of this and I'm already noticing what's gonna be kind of
a problem this is a very cheap IKEA kitchen cabinet which means that these
drawers are as cheap as they get and they're not full extension meaning a
whole 7 inches of this drawer is kind of inaccessible because you can't pull it
out all the way I mean it's fine if you get in there and whatever but I'm gonna
have to be mindful of that that I don't put a divider right here and lose the
majority of my drawer or make the decision to just lose that space in
order to be more effective here so I'm not sure that I wasn't didn't realize
that this kind of sucks but now let's make the basic frame
so it fits in the drawer quite nicely I
did not wait long enough to test fit it and let the glue dry so when I pulled it
out it kind of came apart I'm actually gonna tape it together a little bit just
to keep it even more secure until the glue dries I also took a little bit of
yellow tape and marked the spot where the desk top and so I know where my kind
of visibility line ends in this thing when laying things out I want to kind of
be mindful of that it's just gonna be a matter of actually laying out the items
in a way that I think works best and then cutting some dividers and gluing
them in and then hopefully I have a suite organizer
all right so I have this mostly laid out
I don't have everything sorted because I kind of want to start getting some real
dividers locked in to figure out where the last little bit and up but this is
pretty much it it's a little bit tricky because I want everything to have a nice
neat clean space but that means being wasteful because if everything is laid
out well it's not a big pile of junk that you know allows for more things to
fit inside it especially with odd shaped things like this carpenter's square but
this is such an important tool for me I use it all the time I'm actually almost
wondering if I should keep this tool out of here I use this so much and it's such
an awkward size thing I think I'm gonna find a home for this outside of this
drawer which frees up all of this spot here to add some of the stuff I was
unsure about I'm gonna cut up some dividers get this bottom section laid
out and then figure out the top and I'm also gonna use my cell phone to take a
picture of this so when I take it all out I kind of remember what my idea was
all right makes sense right
[Applause]
all right I got this thing basically done you know may have noticed that I
switched to hot glue very quickly because I just didn't want this to take
all day PVA glue and patience would be the
nicest way to construct this but I didn't have patience so I just use hot
glue it's messy kind of smears everywhere I want to get things in the
wrong spot and I quit measuring my layouts and I just kind of hacked it
together because this was not something I wanted to dedicate a lot of time and
effort to I just wanted it done I just got put it in the drawer and
finished cleaning things up I'm gonna do something stupid and I'm gonna try to
lift this in with all the stuff in it cuz I don't feel like taking it out
again and putting it all back hopefully this doesn't break I know it wasn't the
most exciting of projects but sometimes you've got to do the work that's not
exciting in order to make the exciting work possible and I don't know about you
but my creativity really thrives in an environment that is clean and organized
I know that's not the same for everybody but that's how I work if you take all
the time spent digging around looking for things distraction add it all up
that's a lot of build time and time for your hobby is important and you should
cherish it and you shouldn't waste it digging through drawers so you can adapt
this to whatever situation you have if you don't have a desk with drawers if
you're not that lucky you got some totes whatever grab some foam core make some
organized bins and it'll make your crafting life a
lot easier and a lot more enjoyable and trust me you will make better use of
your hobby tough time long-term at the very least I hope seeing an insight into
my most important tool drawer my little hand tools was informative and
insightful of course if you want to pick up any of the stuff I have most of this
